intro: Uruparia versicolor, commonly known as the variable uruparia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers that vary in hue, hence its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its visual appeal and adaptability.
